title: Make starting automatic
text: Keep a default workspace. Same place, same setup, less resistance.

title: Work with your energy
text: Try one 25-minute block and stop. Short blocks are easier to start when tired. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Make the task smaller
text: Pick the smallest slice that still counts. Not 'finish the report'—more like 'write headings + one messy paragraph'.

title: Reset without guilt
text: Guilt burns energy. Say: 'okay, next step now'—then do two minutes. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Work with your energy
text: If evenings are low-energy, move thinking work earlier and keep evenings lighter. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Work with your energy
text: When you’re drained, make the goal ‘show up’, not ‘crush it’. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Kill the perfection loop
text: First pass is allowed to be ugly. Polish is a separate session. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Make the task smaller
text: Start with a throwaway draft for 10 minutes. No polishing. You’re proving you can begin. Keep the goal embarrassingly small—just enough to restart momentum.

title: Decide what ‘done’ means
text: Pick 3 outcomes for today. Too many goals turns into avoidance. Write the next step somewhere visible before you quit.

title: Recover properly
text: Take real breaks (no doomscrolling). A 5-minute walk resets attention better. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Reduce distraction friction
text: Before starting: phone away, tabs closed, notifications off. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Work with your energy
text: When you’re drained, make the goal ‘show up’, not ‘crush it’. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Make time real
text: Use an if-then plan: IF it’s 7pm, THEN one 25-minute block. Keep the goal embarrassingly small—just enough to restart momentum.

title: Make time real
text: Use an if-then plan: IF it’s 7pm, THEN one 25-minute block. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Decide what ‘done’ means
text: Write what done means before you begin: pages, slides, tests, or a commit. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Keep it consistent
text: Track starts, not hours. Frequency builds identity. Keep the goal embarrassingly small—just enough to restart momentum.

title: Keep it consistent
text: Never miss two days in a row. One miss happens; two becomes a pattern. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Reset without guilt
text: Treat this like an experiment. Change one variable for a week and observe. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Make time real
text: Put the block on your calendar. If it’s not scheduled, it becomes optional.

title: Recover properly
text: Hydration and food matter more than you think—fix basics first. Write the next step somewhere visible before you quit.

title: Make time real
text: Put the block on your calendar. If it’s not scheduled, it becomes optional.

title: Keep it consistent
text: Attach work to an existing habit: after breakfast → 10 minutes.

title: Kill the perfection loop
text: Do one thing that makes the task less scary: outline, collect refs, make a TODO list. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Make time real
text: Compress deadlines: draft earlier, polish later. Keep the goal embarrassingly small—just enough to restart momentum.

title: Reduce distraction friction
text: Start with the easiest subtask. Momentum first, difficulty later. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Reduce distraction friction
text: Use the single-tab rule: one task open; everything else goes to a note. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

text: Put the block on your calendar. If it’s not scheduled, it becomes optional. Write the next step somewhere visible before you quit.

title: Reduce distraction friction
text: Use the single-tab rule: one task open; everything else goes to a note. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Make time real
text: Compress deadlines: draft earlier, polish later. Write the next step somewhere visible before you quit.

title: Reset without guilt
text: Lower the stakes: it’s practice reps, not judgement. Keep the goal embarrassingly small—just enough to restart momentum.

title: Reduce distraction friction
text: Use the single-tab rule: one task open; everything else goes to a note. Do it once today. Consistency comes later.

title: Work with your energy
text: Try one 25-minute block and stop. Short blocks are easier to start when tired. If it helps, set a 10-minute timer and stop on time.

title: Keep it consistent
text: Never miss two days in a row. One miss happens; two becomes a pattern. Keep the goal embarrassingly small—just enough to restart momentum.

title: Reduce distraction friction
text: Use the single-tab rule: one task open; everything else goes to a note.
